learning_outcomes.description: Develop a research-focussed approach to the solution of a new problem, beginning with the development of research questions.
Apply project management techniques to plan and carry out a research project in the allocated time frame, within the available resources and in a safe and ethical manner.
Competently search the scientific literature to critically evaluate previous research.
Offer clear and logical explanations of scientific concepts that may be unfamiliar to the non-specialist through both oral and written communication.
Incorporate Indigenous perspectives in research in a respectful and meaningful way.
Apply fundamental data analysis tools to analyse quantitative and qualitative results.
Be familiar with the contexts of scientific research, and the various research activities that take place within the Faculty’s schools and research centres.

assessments.weighting: <dd>48% - This weight is indicative only. This is a pass/fail course.  </dd>
assessments.due_date: Each worksheet must be submitted within ten working days of the relevant workshop being delivered.
assessments.task_description: During this course, there will be eight workshops (including one that involves field trip options). Associated with each workshop is a worksheet. Worksheets include pre-workshop preparation, workshop participation and post-workshop tasks.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submit this assessment item via the link on Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.category: Notebook/ Logbook, Participation/ Student contribution, Reflection
assessments.task_description:
Documentation of activities of multidisciplinary student teams to collaboratively develop and refine their research communication products (3MT-style presentations and research pitches) over the semester.

Documentation should include summaries of group meetings/discussions, and samples of drafts and peer feedback.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submit this assessment item via the link on Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.topic:
Developmental work with peers

Throughout the semester, students will work in multidisciplinary groups to collaboratively develop and refine their research communication products (3MT-style presentations and research pitches).

Students will be assigned to teams. Each group will consist of students from multiple Schools in the Faculty of Science.  

The activity will largely be self-paced and self-managed by student groups. Students organise and run their own meetings. Each team should meet multiple times.

Peers in each team will support each other to develop their oral presentations and written research pitches, through a process of discussion and feedback. Students are expected to read drafts and comment on each other's work, and revise their own work for final submission.

Group activities (including group meetings, drafts, and peer feedback) will be documented, and submitted as a related assessment item. 


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L04, L07

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom O-week To Week 8(21 Jul - 21 Sep)
learning_activities.topic:
Workshops

From O-Week (Orientation Week) to two-thirds through the semester, weekly workshops are scheduled.


The workshops cover a wide range of topics in research methods (beyond disciplinary knowledge).

Topics of the workshops are:

  • Introduction to science research
  • Research literature
  • Project design and management
  • Research ethics and integrity
  • Cultural competency
  • Research field trips
  • Communication of research
  • Quantitative tools


For each workshop, students will use a worksheet, and be provided with additional resources through Blackboard and/or presentations.

Students will be expected to complete short pre-workshop tasks. Workshop presentations will provide prompts for discussion. Some post-workshop tasks will also be expected to be completed by students.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05, L06, L07

learning_activities.topic:
3MT-style presentations

This item is a learning activity as well as an assessment. Each student will deliver a 3MT-style presentation. Attendance at a '3MT conference' is compulsory.


Learning outcomes: L04, L07
